title: Rickey McGill
text:
Rickey Isiah Justin McGill Jr. (born June 19, 1997) is an American professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player for <a href="Soproni%20KC">Soproni KC</a> of the <a href="Nemzeti%20Bajnoks%C3%A1g%20I/A%20%28men%27s%20basketball%29">Nemzeti Bajnokság I/A</a>. He played <a href="college%20basketball">college basketball</a> for the <a href="Iona%20Gaels%20men%27s%20basketball">Iona Gaels</a>.
High school career.
McGill attended <a href="Spring%20Valley%20High%20School%20%28New%20York%29">Spring Valley High School</a>. He helped lead Spring Valley to a 23-2 record during his senior season and an appearance in the state final four, earning Section 1's Mr. Basketball honors. McGill averaged 23.3 points per game. In the Class A regional final against <a href="Saugerties%20High%20School">Saugerties High School</a>, McGill hit the game-winning buzzer-beating three-pointer and finished with 21 points and four assists. He finished second on Rockland County's all-time scoring list with 1,463 points.
College career.
McGill averaged 2.8 points per game as a freshman at <a href="Iona%20Gaels%20men%27s%20basketball">Iona</a> and remained with the program even though coach <a href="Tim%20Cluess">Tim Cluess</a> advised him to transfer. McGill entered the starting lineup in his following season. On February 25, 2018, he scored a career-high 40 points in a 110–101 loss to <a href="Rider%20Broncs%20men%27s%20basketball">Rider</a>. As a junior, McGill averaged 13.4 points, 5.6 assists and four rebounds per game, earning Second Team All-<a href="Metro%20Atlantic%20Athletic%20Conference">Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference</a> (MAAC) honors. In his senior season, after leading Iona to the <a href="2019%20MAAC%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20Tournament">2019 MAAC Tournament</a> title and winning <a href="most%20valuable%20player">most valuable player</a> accolades, he became the first player in conference history to appear in the <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20Tournament">NCAA Tournament</a> for four straight years. McGill averaged 15.8 points, 4.8 assists and 4.5 rebounds per game and was named to the First Team All-MAAC.
Professional career.
On August 22, 2019, McGill signed his first professional contract with <a href="Panionios%20B.C.">Panionios</a> of the <a href="Greek%20Basket%20League">Greek Basket League</a>. He averaged 7.6 points, 2.7 rebounds and 3.5 assists per game and parted ways with the club after the league was suspended indefinitely due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Greece">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. On August 27, McGill signed with the <a href="Plymouth%20Raiders">Plymouth Raiders</a> of the <a href="British%20Basketball%20League">British Basketball League</a>.
McGill began the 2021–22 season with <a href="Rapla%20KK">Rapla KK</a> of the Estonian league. He averaged 17.8 points, 3.4 rebounds, 6.0 assists and 2.4 steals per game in five games. On November 8, 2021, McGill signed with <a href="Soproni%20KC">Soproni KC</a> of the Hungarian <a href="Nemzeti%20Bajnoks%C3%A1g%20I/A%20%28men%27s%20basketball%29">Nemzeti Bajnokság I/A</a>.
